intro: Grossera, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically yellow or purple in color. It is native to the Americas but has been introduced to other tropical regions. Grossera is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
